ygData.subject: RE: OMG!  GZ finally replied
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Is this conjectured song behavior or a FRPG methodology that we re assuming applies to EQ?  I would think that the vast majority of people that play EQ
ygData.messageBody:
> I've been using Lullaby a lot recently to take down multiple blues while
> soloing. From what I have observed, it seems to work similarly
> to our other
> songs. When the effect goes off the mobs get a chance to resist. If they
> fail to resist they nod. When they would next get to attack they get a
> chance to break the nod, if they do they attack. Just as with some other
> songs this results in the effect getting broken before it ever
> costs the MOB
> anything.

Is this conjectured song behavior or a FRPG methodology that we're assuming
applies to EQ? I would think that the vast majority of people that play EQ
(myself included) would expect to see some tangible result from a "nods"
message. I suppose one way of checking this might be to tangle with a
high-blue caster, lullaby him and see how often he might nod and be
interrupted (tangible result) and yet still awaken in time to physically
strike you in that same round. This would seem to demonstrate the above
theory to be true.

Crier
